translations.chinese: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。
translations.english: When Emperor Gaozu rose to power, he could no longer find the old man.

translations.chinese: 高祖為亭長，乃鲈竹皮為冠，令求盜之薛治，時時冠之，及貴常冠，所謂「劉氏冠」也。
translations.english: While Emperor Gaozu was the local magistrate, he made a crown from bamboo bark. He was ordered to hunt bandits in Xuezhi and sometimes wore it. Even after rising to power, he wore it constantly. This became known as the "Liu Family Crown."

translations.chinese: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒驪山，徒多道亡。
translations.english: As the local magistrate, Emperor Gaozu was assigned by the county to escort convicts to Mount Lishan. Most of the convicts escaped along the way.

translations.chinese: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中亭，止飲，夜皆解縱所送徒。
translations.english: He figured that by the time they arrived, all would have fled. When they reached the pavilion in the western marsh of Feng, he stopped for a drink. At night, all the convicts escaped.
